titleproper.value:
Guide to the Manny Harriman Video Oral History Collection
            <num>ALBA.VIDEO.048</num>

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace
        <date>2017-09-08T14:12:54</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

unittitle.value: Manny Harriman Video Oral History Collection

abstract.value:
Manny Harriman (1919-1997) was a
        veteran of both the Spanish Civil War (he served under his birth name, Samuel Nahman) and
        World War II who later pursued careers in tool and die making and publishing. Following his
        first return trip to Spain in 1977, Harriman became interested in the history of his fellow
        Spanish Civil War veterans. The collection consists of oral history interviews he began
        videotaping in 1985 with veterans and/or their surviving relatives and friends across the
        country. The collection also contains a small number of recordings of VALB political
        activities during the mid-1980s, particularly around aid to Nicaragua. Harriman captured the
        personal histories of at least 180 veterans. The interviews cover veteransâ€™ family
        histories, their motivations for joining the Abraham Lincoln Brigade, their experiences
        fighting in Spain and later in World War II, and their activities in subsequent
        years.

p.value:
Materials are open to researchers. Please contact the Tamiment Library & Robert F.
        Wagner Labor Archives for more information and to schedule an appointment,
        tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu or 212-998-2630.

<emph render="bold">Subseries IIB: Audio</emph>, consists mostly of audiocassettes recorded
        by Manny Harriman. Most notable are the many cassettes recorded on VALB's trip to Spain in
        1983.

corpname.value: Veterans of the Abraham Lincoln Brigade. Bay Area Post

dsc.value:
Series I: Manny Harriman Oral History Project Conditions Governing Access

Access copies for some materials are available by appointment for reading room viewing and listening only. Please contact the Tamiment Library & Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives for more information and to schedule an appointment, tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu or 212-998-2630.

 Aalto, William (Bill) discussed by Irving (Irv) Goff cuid926 undated 19 1 ALBA V 48-001 General note

Interview with Irving (Irv) Goff about Abraham Lincoln Brigade veteran William (Bill) Aalto. Tape also contains Goff discussing other veterans. Also discusses Alex Kunstlich?

First of two tapes containing interview with Sylvia Acker, widow of Abraham Lincoln Brigade veteran Leon Acker, who died in Spain in July 1938.
